Summary Diversity Strategist and Staffing Program Manager Seeking World Class Talent for Intel Corporation. Responsible for building the strategies that position Intel as an employer of choice and sustain our corporate leadership visibility in industry with, but not exclusively limited to, women and under-represented minorities.  
 
Strengths:  
• Empathy 
- I understand "the other guy's"​ point of view and can use it to bring teams together.  
"Some people think only intellect counts: knowing how to solve problems, knowing how to get by, knowing how to identify an advantage and seize it. But the functions of intellect are insufficient without courage, love, friendship, compassion and empathy."​ 
- Dean Koontz  
 
• Consistency 
- I think that people function best in a consistent environment where the rules are clear and are applied to everyone equally.  
"The secret of success is consistency of purpose."​ 
-Benjamin Disraeli  
 
• Harmony 
- I think conflict is a waste of time and energy so I usually try to find areas where we can all agree. 
- I use my ability to empathize to find the harmony in working relationships. 
- My way may not be THE way but don’t criticize because YOUR way may not be THE way either 
"You don't get harmony when everybody sings the same note."​ 
-Doug Floyd  
 
• Maximizer 
- I've always preferred focusing on people’s strengths rather than their weaknesses.  
- I think everyone has the potential to be EXCELLENT at SOMETHING 
"Continuous excellent effort, not maximum strength or superior IQ, is the key to unlocking your potential as an achiever."​ 
-Greg Werner 
 
- I can usually find the positive in people and I DO give points for effort.  
- If you are sincerely putting forth your best effort, I will go above and beyond to help you succeed 
"We must expect to fail... but fail in a learning posture, determined not to repeat the mistakes, and to maximize the benefits from what is learned in the process. " 
-Ted W. Engstrom

Summary Currently working as a technical project manager and engineer on a team responsible for platform power and performance optimization for mobile products. Manages three projects for the team with responsibilities including regular collaboration meetings, status reports, interfacing with clients, and integrating with driver and firmware teams. Also the lead engineer for WiGig and WiDi power optimization on all projects. 
 
I am always looking for more opportunities for leadership roles with greater scope, and I can offer the unique skills of a project manager with technical expertise. My interests include high-level concept design as well as strategic planning, resource management and allocation, and operations consulting. In addition to my technical degree, I have studied user-centered design, industrial design, human computer interaction and organizational behavior. I continue to educate myself in these and other business areas through online courses. 
 
Personal Skills: 
- Leadership 
- Organization 
- Detail orientation 
- Time management 
- Communication 
- Planning and scheduling 
 
Extra-curricular: 
- President of the Northwestern University Alumni Club of Portland 
- Intel Education Service Corps 
- Volunteer Career Mentor at Dress for Success, Oregon  
- Volunteer Lacrosse Coach, Sunset Girls 5/6 
 
In my free time I enjoy community service, traveling, photography and outdoor activities. I am SCUBA certified, work as an interior design consultant for friends, and am writing a young-adult adventure novel. Summary I currently lead all software products development and technology initiatives for Huron Consulting’s healthcare practice. I have been in this position since 2007 and during this time I built the product development organization from the ground up, creating a top-flight, scalable development organization that varies between 50 and 100 team members depending on current projects. Our successes included cutting development time significantly through agile development; launching a new suite of analytics products which will generate significant sales in their first year; and rebuilding aging flagship product from ground up.  
 
My previous roles included serving as a Technical Project/Program Manager for Intel where I managed multiple large and complex projects leading teams of up to 40 and managing project budgets of up to $6M.  
 
I thrive on the strategic aspects of my work because, for me, technology should always drive business success. The common thread that runs through my entire career is the ability to keep complex initiatives on track no matter how many challenges arise. My colleagues know me as a consummate problem-solver and I thoroughly enjoy working under pressure or facing challenges that have beaten others.  
 
I have a documented history of delivering complex software projects on time and within budget and am known for my ability to turn around stalled projects. My manager has commented that the healthcare practice “could not operate without Rajesh's deep experience and understanding of technology” and complimented my “always calm, measured, and professional” approach to problem-solving.  
 
This last compliment is especially meaningful to me because I take care to always respond calmly when problems arise, so that my team is able to function at their best.  
 
I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and a Masters degree in Management Studies. I am keen to reconnect with former colleagues or make new connections so please feel free to contact me via this page. Experience Director of Engineering Huron Consulting Group February 2007  – Present (8 years 7 months) Lake Oswego, Oregon I was recruited by Huron to build and lead the product development organization. I’m accountable for project management, engineering management, QA, architecture and development infrastructure supporting the company’s healthcare consulting practice. I develop the technology strategy and manage the full development lifecycle from conception to final delivery, working closely with business leaders.  
 
When I was first hired, I faced the need to upgrade the technology infrastructure, rebuild a depleted team and implement a development methodology from scratch. 
Since that time, I have built top-performing, highly skilled and scalable technology organization whose size has ranged from 50 to 100 in recent years, implemented agile development methodology cutting development time and improving predictability, and significantly upgraded the technology infrastructure.  
 
I have also grown revenues by enabling the launch of 5 new analytics products, which are expected to generate multimillion-dollar revenues.
